Sentencas: This paper focuses on modeling membrane-polarization processes within mixed-conducting electrolyte membranes.
Titulo: Membrane polarization in mixed-conducting ceramic fuel cells and electrolyzers

Sentencas: Because a complete set of thermodynamic and transport properties is available, the electrolyte material used for the study is a yttrium-doped barium zirconate (BaZr0.9 Y-0.1 O3-delta, BZY10).
Titulo: Membrane polarization in mixed-conducting ceramic fuel cells and electrolyzers

Sentencas: Unlike Polymer Electrolyte Fuel Cells (PEMFC) and Solid-Oxide Fuel Cells (SOFC), the open-circuit voltage cannot be evaluated using gas phase compositions alone.
Titulo: Membrane polarization in mixed-conducting ceramic fuel cells and electrolyzers

Sentencas: Using a Nernst-Planck-Poisson (NPP) model, an important aspect of the present paper is to develop the theory needed to evaluate open-circuit potential.
Titulo: Membrane polarization in mixed-conducting ceramic fuel cells and electrolyzers

Sentencas: Focusing on the mixed-conducting membrane alone, the present model neglects all activation and concentration overpotentials.
Titulo: Membrane polarization in mixed-conducting ceramic fuel cells and electrolyzers

Sentencas: The model is exercised in both fuel-cell and electrolyzer modes, revealing significantly different polarization behaviors.
Titulo: Membrane polarization in mixed-conducting ceramic fuel cells and electrolyzers

Sentencas: The model based results show how the membrane polarization depends upon operating conditions, including temperature and gas-phase compositions.
Titulo: Membrane polarization in mixed-conducting ceramic fuel cells and electrolyzers
